result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Adjudication/sentencing hearing at 02-15-2016 02:30 pm
Drug Court Diversion Program Minute Sheet

Defendant in court with Attorney Michelle Tjader. Ismael Ozanne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Pearson appeared for JMH. Attorney Tjader argued for defendant's continuation in diversion court. Attorney Ozanne made statement in favor of termination. Defendant made statement. Court ordered termination of defendant's drug court contract. File forwarded to trial Br. 7 for scheduling of sentencing hearing. Bail revoked pending sentencing hearing.
Order for Court Review on February 2, 2016 at 9:00 AM

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall remain within his residence at 49 Fairlane Ct., Madison 53713 except for work or treatment appointments, or if accompanied by one of his parents (as approved by BMP.) Defendant may be outside on the property at his residence without his parents present and without contacting BMP for approval. 
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alayna W.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall cooperate and follow all rules of the Dane County Drug Court Diversion Program.
- Defendant shall not be at Motel 6 on Thierer Rd or Stoughton Rd in Madison, WI.
